note.p: Death: His house in Henrietta Street, Covent Garden, London (04 July 1744)
Burial: St Paul's, Covent Garden, London
Memorial: Monumental inscription in St Bride's Church, Fleet Street, London
Education: Eton College; Queens' College, Cambridge; MB (1694), MD (Com Reg 1705); Padua (admitted 1695)
Career: Travelled to Italy with Richard Mead (FRS 1703); practised in London (1707-death) but preferred to give his time to study
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DNB; Venn; Thomas; Munk's Roll
